properties.address: Audley Rd, Saffron Walden CB11 3HD, UK
properties.description: Winter initiative: WARM SPACES Fridays 10 am -12 noon (from 25 November): Our hall is open as a warm and welcoming spac​e, for anyone who wants to drop in for a free tea or coffee, use the free wi-fi or take part in some activities ...and keep warm. There is a similar scheme being offered by Churches Together on Mondays, in the Town Hall, 10.00am till 3.00pm
properties.title: Saffron Walden Baptist Church – Warm Spaces

properties.address: Market St, Saffron Walden CB10, UK
properties.description: Working in conjunction with Churches Together in Saffron Walden, the Town Council is pleased to offer a FREE Warm Welcome Hub. The FREE Warm Welcome opens on Monday 28th November and every Monday thereafter (until 19th December) between 10.00-15.00 in the Town Hall, Saffron Walden. Please enter via the back door, facing Starbucks. The Warm Welcome will then recommence in 2023 on Monday 9th January 2023, again from 10.00 – 15:00 every Monday. On offer will be tea, coffee, biscuits throughout the day, along with soup and a roll from 12.00–14.00. There will also be FREE Wi-Fi, games, cards and provision for phone charging. Everyone is welcome to attend and no booking is required. Please come along and join us, sit and have a chat, cuppa and a bowl of warm soup in a safe, warm space. We would be grateful if anyone has any board games or puzzles, they would be willing to donate for use at the Warm Welcome. Any games or puzzles should be full sets (i.e., no pieces missing) and donations can be dropped off to the Warm Hub during the opening hours on a Monday (back of the Town Hall between 10.00-15.00.)
properties.title: Saffron Walden Town Council- Warm Welcome Hub

properties.address: Crafton Grn, Chapel Hill, Stansted Mountfitchet, Stansted CM24 8AQ, UK
properties.description: We are a community hub in Stansted Mountfitchet, Essex. We are based at Crafton Green, right next door to the Library and the Crafton Green car park. We have a welcoming community café every Thursday and Friday, and a community garden that is open every day. As a community hub, people can access help and support from our partner organisations, join clubs and interest groups, and share their skills with others if they would like. At the heart of our centre is the TouchPoint Stansted Café. Alongside this, we make full use of this wonderful community building by running regular activities including walking groups, financial advice clinics, digital skills support, free breakfast club,community support groups and employment advice – to name but a few! We are also lucky to have a wonderful community garden, which will be cared for entirely by volunteers. It’s a tranquil spot, perfect to relax and unwind in, and is open to all to enjoy. We also run six weekly community food shares at three different locations distributing surplus supermarket food for free. These are open to everyone in the community, please see our website or social media for the most up to date timetable. The TouchPoint Community Café is open every Thursday from 11am to 5pm, and every Friday from 10am to 12pm, and is a welcoming place to catch up with friends and relax. We serve a selection of hot and cold drinks and snacks, with hot food available on Thursdays between 12.30pm and 2.30pm. Tea, coffee and squash are FREE, and cakes and snacks are available to buy. We also have a ‘Pay it Forward’ donation box if you would like to make a contribution. The hot food menu changes every week, and booking is recommended, please email book@thetouchpoint.org or contact us to reserve your meal. We are a Warm Space.
properties.title: Touch Point Stansted

properties.address: Abbey Ln, Saffron Walden CB10 1AG, UK
properties.description: The Oasis If you are feeling overwhelmed, worn out, cold or just want a friendly chat, help is at hand at The Salvation Army in Saffron Walden every Wednesday from 10am to 2:30pm. That’s because we have launched Oasis Drop-in at our hall on Abbey Lane and anyone who wants a few minutes away from the trials and tribulations of modern life is welcome to drop in.
properties.title: Oasis Drop in – Saffron Walden, Salvation Army

properties.address: High St, Saffron Walden CB10 1AA, UK
properties.description: Somewhere 2 Sing offers weekly, local based adult singing groups across Hertfordshire, Bedfordshire and now into Essex. The music is popular, the classes are informal and it doesn’t matter whether you’ve been in choirs before or are coming along as a complete beginner, as you’ll be welcomed with open arms. Groups can range from about thirty to eighty members in each choir, with members spanning all ages. Come for the great music, make new friends, you can perform with us, and it’s great for mental health and well-being too. We are always working towards new exciting projects, which might be a recording, a flash mob, a local community event or a large-scale production – in which all our groups combine for an epic concert. There’s never any obligation to perform but read some of our members’ testimonials and check out some of the videos on our media page, as once you’ve taken the plunge and sung with a few hundred people, you certainly get the bug and will most likely want to do it again and again.
properties.title: Somewhere to Sing
